## Objetivo 

In RSA d is a lot bigger than e, why don't we use d to encrypt instead of e? Connect with `nc jupiter.challenges.picoctf.org 19566`.

## Solución  

```java 
┌──(kali㉿kali)-[~/picoCTF/crypto/b00tl3gRSA2]
└─$ nc jupiter.challenges.picoctf.org 19566
c: 
n: 
e: 

┌──(kali㉿kali)-[~/picoCTF/crypto/b00tl3gRSA2]
└─$ python3
Python 3.12.6 (main, Sep  7 2024, 14:20:15) [GCC 14.2.0] on linux
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> 
>>> 
>>> 
>>> e=65537
>>> m=pow(c,e,n)
>>> m
180638594769037903267909311328535969949661653321164402927482237
>>> print(hex(m))
0x7069636f4354467b6261645f31643361355f323433383132357d
>>> 
```


Convertimos el texto dado en la pagina de CyberChef, From Hex

```java 
picoCTF{bad_1d3a5_2438125}
```

Bianca Delgado Chairez 7A
